refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The PAoptions function can be used to change different parameters in the way PAsolve behaves. There are two ways of changing parameters: directly via the PAoptions function or by editing the PAoptions.ini file.

The PAoptions.ini file is located in ScilabConnector/config/PAoptions.ini . The file is loaded when the ProActive toolbox is also loaded. Any subsequent change to the file won't be taken into account.
In order to change configuration dynamically inside the Scilab session, calls to PAoptions must be made. Each PAsolve call will retrieve the current state of options and behave accordingly.

listitem.para: a string containing the option to change
the new value of the option
JobName: Name of the job that will be submitted to the scheduler.
JobDescription: Description of the job that will be submitted to the scheduler.
Debug: enables debug mode in PAsolve calls (very verbose).
TransferEnv: enables transferring the local environment (local and global variables).
EnvExcludeList: controls witch variables should NOT be copied when using TransferEnv, by listing their names (Comma separated list).
EnvExcludeTypeList: controls witch variable types should NOT be copied when using TransferEnv (Comma separated list).
Fork: enables running the Scilab task in a separate JVM from the Scheduler Node.

RunAsMe: enables running the Scilab task as the user provided when connecting to the scheduler (implies Fork mode). Depending on which RunAsMe mode is configured on the scheduler, it might be necessary to provide additional credential information when connecting via PAconnect.

SharedPushPublicUrl, SharedPullPublicUrl, SharedPushPrivateUrl, SharedPullPrivateUrl and SharedAutomaticTransfer: those url are those used by the Shared DataSpace on the scheduler (if it's activated on the scheduler). The Push urls define the spaces where task input files are pushed to. The Pull urls are the spaces from which task output files are pulled. The public urls are accessible from anywhere, the private urls are accessible only by worker nodes. Contact the scheduler administrator to know these values. Both url (public and private) can be equal, but if the infrastucture allows it, it is more efficient to use a file url as private, the computing nodes will then access the space directly via a shared file system like NFS The option SharedAutomaticTransfer is an internal option and should not be modified.

RemoveJobAfterRetrieve: Removes the job automatically from the scheduler after all results have been retrieved. If not the job is removed at the end of the scilab session, or manually via PAjobRemove. default to 'on'
NbTaskExecution: Defines how many times a task can be executed (in case of error). It defaults to 2, to limit accidental crash of the remote engine due to memory limitations.

CustomDataspaceURL andCustomDataspacePath: by default these options are not set. Dataspaces are a ProActive internal mechanism allowing a shared file system between hosts. The mechanism allows the automatic transfer of files between the local scilab session and the remote engines. ProActive Toolbox has an internal automatic Dataspace creation, or can be used in conjunction with a Shared Dataspace (see above). But sometimes, one would like to rely on an external Dataspace such as a ftp server. This Dataspace MUST be accessible from the local file system in order to work with Scilab Connector Toolbox.The CustomDataspaceURL option gives the Universally accessible URL of this dataspace and the CustomDataspacePath gives the path to access this dataspace from the local file system.

VersionPref, VersionMin, VersionMax and VersionRej: these options allow the user to define which version of Scilab should/should not be used. In an heterogeneous environment, several versions of scilab can be available simultaneously on the network. These options ensures that the submitted scilab code will meet the correct scilab version. It is the responsibility of the user to find which versions are/are not compatible with the code.

VersionPref: is the preferred version to use. It won't prevent another version to be used if the preferred version is not available.It is set automatically to the version of the local scilab session, but can be as well user defined via this option.
VersionMin and VersionMax: is the minimum/maximum version to use. It is set by default to the minimum/maximum version supported
VersionRej: is a list of versions to be rejected.
VersionArch: The scilab version architecture to be used. "Any" means any architecture can be used, "32" means only 32bit architectures and "64" means only 64-bit architectures.

ForceScilabSearch: Do we force the automated search of Scilab ? In the default behavior, this is set to false. The selection script will try to search Scilab only if a ScilabWorkerConfiguration.xml cannot be found on the host. If the script finds some Scilab instances it will create a new ScilabWorkerConfiguration.xml to speed up latter executions. If on the contrary ForceScilabSearch is set to true, the selection script will always search the disk for Scilab installations
Priority: this option is the priority of jobs created inside the ProActive Scheduler by PAsolve calls. Default to "Normal".

WindowsStartupOptions and LinuxStartupOptions: these options define the startup options used to start the remote Scilab engine on Windows(or Linux). Default to "-nwni" which allows scilab to start on machines without a display.
FindScilabScript: this option sets the script used to find Scilab on the remote host. Changing the script means modifying the toolbox internal behavior and is therefore not recommended.
FindMatSciScriptStatic: (Internal) defines the way the FindScilabScript script behave
CustomScript: with this option, a custom selection script can be provided for every jobs launched via PAsolve.
CustomScriptStatic: a boolean, true if the CustomScript is a static one (executed only once on a given machine), otherwise the CustomScript will be dynamic (default).
CustomScriptParams: a string containing the parameters of the custom script, delimited by spaces.
PathJars,EmbeddedJars, WorkerJars andProActiveJars: libraries used by Scilab Connector Toolbox (internal use only)
ProActiveConfiguration: path to ProActive Configuration file (modifying this option requires knowledge of ProActive internals).
Log4JConfiguration: path to log4j configuration file (internal).
SecurityFile: path to java security configuration file (internal).
RmiPort: default RMI port used to deploy the middleman JVM (internal).
JvmTimeout: default timeout used when deploying the middleman JVM (internal).
JvmArguments: optional JVM arguments to the middleman JVM (internal).
WorkerTimeoutStart: Timeout used to start the scilab engine (*10ms) (internal).
EnableDisconnectedPopup: a popup will appear when the matlab session finishes and some jobs are uncomplete (internal).
